user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_get_connection_values_n:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN int
MHD_get_connection_values_n (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                             enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                             MHD_KeyValueIteratorN iterator,
                             void *iterator_cls)
{
  int ret;
  struct MHD_HTTP_Req_Header *pos;

  if (NULL == connection)
    return -1;
  ret = 0;

  if (NULL == iterator)
    for (pos = connection->rq.headers_received; NULL != pos; pos = pos->next)
    {
      if (0 != (kind & pos->kind))
        ret++;
    }
  else
    for (pos = connection->rq.headers_received; NULL != pos; pos = pos->next)
      if (0 != (kind & pos->kind))
      {
        ret++;
        if (MHD_NO == iterator (iterator_cls,
                                pos->kind,
                                pos->header,
                                pos->header_size,
                                pos->value,
                                pos->value_size))
          return ret;
      }
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No explicit compiler language extensions are present in the shown code: there are no uses of __attribute__, __declspec, __asm, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, computed gotos (&&label), __extension__ or other known compiler-specific keywords/constructs. All constructs used (standard enum, pointers, struct member access, function pointer call, macros, comparisons) are valid standard C.

One potential area to check (not reported as a confirmed extension) is the macro _MHD_EXTERN at the function start — macros can expand to compiler-specific storage-class specifiers or attributes (for example __declspec(...) or __attribute__((...))). Because the expansion is not shown here, it is not possible to assert that an extension is used. Reviewers should inspect the definition of _MHD_EXTERN to ensure it does not expand to a compiler-specific extension. Apart from that, no other fragments warrant investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
